greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(q^3) / psi(q)^3 in powers of q where psi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q)^3 * eta(q^6)^2 / ( eta(q^2)^6 * eta(q^3) ) in powers of q.
a(n) = (-1)^n * A132974(n). Convolution inverse of A107760.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ 4 EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^(3/2)] / EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^(1/2)]^3, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 20 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^3 * eta(x^6 + A )^2 / ( eta(x^2 + A)^6 * eta(x^3 + A) ), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 07 2007
